1.content:
I was at the store with my brother.
Everything was normal until my brother said, “Why are you over there?”
“I’m... here.” I replied.
“No, while we were going up the escalator, you were just over there going DOWN.”
I got a bit nervous and swallowed hard.
After a while, I whispered that your Doppelgänger can possess you.
“Wait, they can?” His dark eyes widened.
“Yea.”
A bit later, when we were going back down, he said, “She’s going up...”
I looked at the escalator again.
It was empty.
A Doppelgänger is a spirit. Almost never seen by you, but they see you.
What do you think my brother has?
Some sort of psychic ability to see spirits?
I know he does.
He can see them when no one else does.
There’s a special gene in my family, allowing some to possess strange powers.
If my mom could see the future, then probably he has a power too, right?
Lemme guess, you don’t believe me.
But it’s true, I would have never survived the 2011 Japanese Tsunami if she couldn’t.
And all it took was canceling a plane flight.
That same plane I was about to take was destroyed by the tsunami.
I know that I wasn’t dreaming.
1.title: Look At Me

11.content:
Regnagleppod
“You know the time I went to someone’s house when I was 6? I didn’t go there...” He paused and gave me a solemn glance.
“Wait, what?” They never mentioned this before, and 9 year old me couldn’t quite comprehend this.
“I went to an abandoned house,” He continued, “a walk around the block lead me there. I saw someone quite peculiar. He was my exact opposite, with snow white hair, pale blue eyes, and light skin. We eventually bet that if he won a chess match, my family could be killed-“
“You what?” I looked at him, trying to keep my cool. Did he really be a total jerk and risk our lives? Doesn’t he know we only get one life?
“-and I would be banished to the spirit world for billions of years. If I won, he would be banished. If I could beat him with only two pawns, he would be banished forever.” The look on his face had a calm smile.
“And you did?”
“Precisely-“
“Whatever.” I rolled my eyes.
“Well I won and that is how you are alive right now.”
“Promise me you will never try to find him...” His voice grew thinner and thinner as his eyes closed.
After that, he continued to talk as if no time had passed. I shivered, but he didn’t seem to notice.
“I... I’m just going to read in my room.” I said quickly, as I shook with every step towards the door.
11.title: Next Story

15.content:
The door opened and a breath of fresh air blew across the table, the one that held the book, âOur name is Melancholy.â Fresh air leads to putridness, which cycles back with new life. This room has no occupants, nothing that could breathe in the vibrant air and know it for what it was. However, there was a body of a man laying head down on the table as if merely sleeping.

         Within the unmoving body, a soul struggled with its condition, being that its connection to its body was severed but the thing could not leave. The struggle rang like a bell through the aethyrs, calling, then, the Dark Angel himself to grace the room and quiet the soul. Death brought the calm that would separate the soul from the body for the final time. He exuded a sense of belonging that should have felt wrong for a Reaper such as him, but in truth, He delivered rightness to the wronged.

         Once the soul was removed, the Reaper released the soul up and onto the air.

         Some winds travel the universe, but some must feed the earth and its creaturesâ¦
15.title: Leading with fresh air for all.
